Title: Understanding California Hardwoods
Content: Discussion of the important physical, mechanical and woodworking properties of some common California hardwood species. Includes information on wood drying principles and practice and a discussion of wood boring insects sometimes encountered by the woodworker. Presented to the Bay Area Woodworkers Association on October 17, 2013.

Title: An Examination of the Oak Woodland as a Potential Resource for Higher-Value Wood Products
Content: In 'Proceedings of a symposium on oak woodland: ecology, management, and urban interface issues; 19-22 March 1996: San Luis Obispo, CA. (General Technical Report PSW-GTR-160, Albany, CA: US Department of Agriculture, Forest Service. Pacific Southwest Research Station.)

Title: Evaluating the survival of Phytophthora ramorum in Firewood
Content: In this follow-up project we specifically analyzed the survival of Phytophthora ramorum in firewood as it was thoroughly air-dried (seasoning) to a final moisture content of 15% MC. The aim was to evaluate the risk of spreading SOD through the distribution of firewood and fuel wood.

Title: Developing a Drying Schedule for a "new-to-You" Species
Content: Information and techniques required for developing a drying schedule for a "new-to-you" wood species, using Tanoak in a detailed example.
